translation.en: [man 1] Don't be afraid to dream big.
translation.ko: 큰 꿈을 품는 걸 두려워하지 마세요

translation.en: Doesn't matter where you come from.
You can show the world…
nothing is impossible.
[man 2] There are only 14 mountains in the world higher than 8,000 meters.
The quest to climb these mountains is a story that goes back 100 years.
translation.ko: 그 산들을 오르는 여정은 100년 전부터 시작됐죠

translation.en: [man 3] Above 8,000 meters in the death zone, it's a very high-stakes game.
translation.ko: 8,000m 위 죽음의 지대에선 목숨을 걸어야 해요

translation.en: The cold, the wind, avalanches.
When a climber gets into trouble
without other strong climbers around them to help,
translation.ko: 주위에 도움을 줄 실력 있는 등반가들이 없다면

translation.en: they're usually left to die.
[man 2] In the history of high-altitude mountaineering,
there is no one respected more than Reinhold Messner.
He was the first climber to summit all the fourteen 8,000-meter peaks.
-It took him 16 years. -[people applauding]
[Messner] Fear is always in you.
You have the feeling, "I am only safe if I'm back in base camp."
translation.ko: 이런 마음이 들죠 '베이스캠프에 가야만 안전해' "라인홀트 메스너 고산 등반가"

translation.en: "Back in civilization."
Climbing all the 8,000-meter peaks in one lifetime is very hard.
translation.ko: 한 생애에 8,000m 봉우리를 전부 다 오르기는 몹시 어렵죠

translation.en: Normally, for a single eight-thousander, it's a major endeavor.
It's a huge two-month expedition just to climb one 8,000-meter peak.
translation.ko: 봉우리 하나만도 2달이 걸리는 대규모 원정이죠 "지미 친 전문 등반가"

translation.en: But sometime in the spring of 2019,
the mountaineering world started talking about this crazy guy from Nepal.
translation.ko: 정신 나간 네팔 남자 얘기로 등반계가 떠들썩해졌어요

translation.en: He was someone that nobody had ever heard of.
translation.ko: 누구도 이 사람에 대해 들어본 적이 없었죠

translation.en: Everyone was asking,
"Who the hell is Nims Purja?"
All right, mate.
[Nims] The fastest time to climb
all the fourteen 8,000-meter peaks was seven years.
If I can stay alive, I can do this in seven months.
translation.ko: 죽지만 않는다면 전 7개월 만에 해낼 수 있어요 "니르말 '님스다이' 푸르자"

translation.en: This is about inspiring the human race.
translation.ko: 이건 인류에게 영감을 주기 위한 여정이에요

translation.en: The climbing community of Nepal
have always been the pioneers of eight-thousanders,
but they never got the respect they deserve.
translation.ko: 그에 걸맞은 존경을 한 번도 받지 못했죠

translation.en: I want to represent the Nepalese climbing community.
translation.ko: 저는 네팔 등반 공동체를 대변하고 싶어요

translation.en: My mission was divided into three phases.
Phase 1 would be Nepal.
I would need to be the first climber in history
to summit six 8,000-meter peaks in the spring season.
translation.ko: 봄철에 전부 등정한 첫 등반가가 되어야 했죠

translation.en: Phase 2 would be in Pakistan,
where I would need to summit K2,
and you've got to be lucky to survive that mountain.
translation.ko: 운이 좋아야 살아남을까 말까 한 산이죠

translation.en: And for Phase 3, I would need to get permission
from the Chinese government to climb in Tibet.
I was told that my plan was impossible.
So I decided to name it Project Possible.
[woman] It was a crazy idea.
But it wasn't a surprise to me.
He's constantly thinking… He's constantly thinking of something.
I don't know what. But his brain doesn't rest at all.
translation.ko: 그게 뭔지는 몰라도 그이의 머리는 쉬질 않아요

translation.en: [Nims] We got married when we were very young.
For her to let me go and do this huge project…
translation.ko: 저의 거대한 프로젝트를 제 아내는 응원해 줬죠

translation.en: Suchi is an amazing human.
She's mentally super strong.
[chuckling] Well, I understood the risk,
uh, but I think it was in his character.
He's very driven.
Finally!
Yeah, finally we're going to do it. Don't worry, I'll be fine.
translation.ko: 마침내 시작하는 거야 난 괜찮을 테니 걱정하지 마

translation.en: Make sure you look after yourself.
[Suchi] It was so dangerous.
But I knew it was gonna be life-changing for him.
translation.ko: 하지만 그이의 인생을 바꿀 기회라는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [Nims] On this project, I will be supported by a team of Nepalese climbers,
translation.ko: 이 프로젝트에서 저는 여정 전체에 걸쳐

translation.en: who would climb with me
on different mountains throughout the expedition.
translation.ko: 네팔 등반가 팀의 도움을 받을 거예요

translation.en: I have to trust these guys with my life.
But I also knew that it was going to be fun.
Good morning, everybody, guys!
Project Possible team!
Mingma is the strongest climber I have ever met.
translation.ko: 밍마는 제가 만나본 가장 강인한 등반가예요 "밍마 데이비드"

translation.en: My right-hand man. Okay?
[Mingma In Nepali] For me, mountaineering is all about exploring.
[Nims in English] Geljen is the best dancer on the planet.
[Geljen in Nepali] Everyone in the team treats each other like brothers.
translation.ko: 이 팀의 일원들은 모두 서로를 형제처럼 대해요

translation.en: We party together.
[Nims in English] Lakpa Dendi, he can carry the size of a house.
translation.ko: 락파 덴디는 집채만 한 짐도 나를 수 있어요

translation.en: [Lakpa in Nepali] I had hope that if we all pulled together, it was possible.
translation.ko: 강력한 협동심만 있다면 해낼 수 있다고 믿었죠

translation.en: This was a good thing for Nepal.
[in English] Here's my brother Gesman! Hey!
[Nims] Gesman, he is willing to put everything on the line.
translation.ko: 게스만은 이 프로젝트를 위해 모든 걸 걸겠단 각오를 했죠

translation.en: [Gesman in Nepali] No one had ever attempted anything like Project Possible.
translation.ko: '프로젝트 파서블' 같은 시도는 그 누구도 한 적 없어요

translation.en: We had to be part of this.
[man] The established way of behaving in mountaineering
is to be very humble and to understate one's goals.
translation.ko: 아주 겸허하게 굴고 목표치를 낮추는 겁니다

translation.en: Nims is very much the opposite. He's very outspoken.
translation.ko: 님스는 정반대였죠 뭐든 숨김이 없었어요 "개릿 매디슨"

translation.en: This is me, I got abdomen, but this gonna go away, you know.
translation.ko: 저 좀 봐요, 뱃살이 쪘죠 하지만 다 빠질 거예요

translation.en: [Madison] When he told me about Project Possible, it was just mind-boggling.
translation.ko: 님스의 프로젝트 이야기를 듣고 정신이 나갈 것 같았죠

translation.en: You're dealing with weather windows,
the logistics, the route conditions…
translation.ko: 실행 계획을 짜고 길의 상태도 생각해야 해요

translation.en: and it's extremely dangerous.
I thought, great ambition here, but not likely to succeed at all.
translation.ko: 야망은 굉장하지만 성공할 리 없다고 생각했어요

translation.en: [Nims] Sometimes you got to focus on something that's very important to you.
translation.ko: 때로는 자신에게 중요한 일에 집중해야 해요

translation.en: I'll make this happen.
And it's going to go away for sure. Boom.
-[man laughing] -Yeah!
It doesn't matter how many times you've been there
translation.ko: 몇 번을 방문했든 몇 번을 봤든 상관없어요

translation.en: and how many times you've seen it.
Your mind just can't comprehend how big Annapurna is.
translation.ko: "돈 보이" 안나푸르나의 크기는 머리로 이해할 수가 없죠

translation.en: It gives you this sense of going to battle
and you're going to fight something pretty mean.
translation.ko: 싸우게 될 거란 인상을 주는 산이에요

translation.en: For every three climbers that make it to the summit,
one dies trying.
I'm Geljen Sherpa. I'm going to summit Annapurna.
translation.ko: 저는 겔젠 셰르파예요 안나푸르나를 오를 거예요

translation.en: Hello! I'm Mingma David Sherpa.
[Mingma in Nepali] I first came to hear about Nims through my uncle
translation.ko: 삼촌한테서 님스 얘길 처음 들었어요 "밍마 데이비드 셰르파"

translation.en: with whom he climbed his first mountain, Lobuche Peak.
translation.ko: "밍마 데이비드 셰르파" 생애 첫 산인 로부체 봉우리를 둘이 함께 올랐죠

translation.en: I told Nims, "I will support you as a brother,
and I will give everything I can for the project."
translation.ko: '이 프로젝트를 위해 뭐든 다 할 거야'

translation.en: [Nims in English] I was leading the fixing team.
translation.ko: 저는 로프 설치 팀을 이끌고 있었어요

translation.en: You set the ropes, opening the route for others.
translation.ko: 로프를 땅에 박아 다른 이들을 위해 길을 열죠

translation.en: This is what it takes to set fixed lines.
See how tired he is, my brother.
translation.ko: 이 친구 지친 것 좀 보세요

translation.en: You know, and see the sun. It's been a struggle today.
Don, my brother. [chuckles]
[Don] I was on Annapurna at the same time as Nims.
translation.ko: 저는 님스와 같은 시기에 안나푸르나에 올랐어요

translation.en: This is my friend Don,
trying to trailblaze on six feet of deep snow.
I've made five different attempts
over 13 years to try to make it to the top of this mountain
translation.ko: 이 산의 정상에 오르려고 다섯 번을 시도했지만

translation.en: and haven't been able to do it.
There is no other climb that I've ever been on
where the mountain is literally crumbling down on top of you.
translation.ko: 머리 위로 쏟아지는 곳은 안나푸르나밖에 없어요

translation.en: It's terrifying.
[Nims] Okay.
[Don] You feel like you have no control.
[Nims] Just in time.
Well, that's just off our shoulders.
[Mingma in Nepali] The weather was good,
but because of the amount of fresh snowfall, it was really hard.
translation.ko: 엄청난 양의 눈이 새로 내려서 정말 힘들었어요

translation.en: [Nims in English] It's super deep.
Somewhere it's waist-deep.
[Mingma in Nepali] After fresh snowfall, there are frequent avalanches.
translation.ko: 눈이 새로 내린 뒤에는 눈사태가 자주 일어나요

translation.en: [Don in English] That was super tough.
There was a point where I gave up,
translation.ko: 어느 지점에 이르러 저는 그냥 포기했어요

translation.en: and I just said, "Nims, this is not going to work."
Giving up is not in the blood, sir. It's not in the blood.
translation.ko: 제 사전에 포기란 없어요 절대로 없죠

translation.en: [Don] That was the first daylight for me about his project.
translation.ko: 님스의 프로젝트를 그렇게 처음 알게 됐어요

translation.en: This guy believed that they were going to do it.
translation.ko: 자기 팀이 할 수 있다고 믿고 있었죠

translation.en: And they pushed through.
[Nims] Summit!
Yes.
See that, man?
[Don] I couldn't be prouder of this guy.
Every time I was like, "Eh, man, things don't look like
they're gonna go through on this, uh, Annapurna climb."
translation.ko: "돈 보이" 실패할 것 같다고 할 때마다

translation.en: He's like, "I believe." Here we are standing on the summit.
translation.ko: 이 친구는 믿는다고 했는데 이렇게 정상에 섰네요

translation.en: -Thank you so much. -Love that.
Love you, brother. That means a lot to me.
translation.ko: 사랑해요, 형제 내게 정말 의미가 커요

translation.en: Yes!
Look at that view.
I was so happy at the summit.
But I was like, "Well, Nims,
the clock starts now."
[Don] We came down from the summit, got to Camp 4, and slept that night.
translation.ko: 우리는 정상에서 캠프 4로 내려와 거기서 하룻밤 잤어요

translation.en: In the morning, Nims poked his head inside the tent.
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침 님스가 텐트 안으로 고개를 들이밀었죠

translation.en: He said, "We got a problem."
"There's a climber from a different team, he didn't come down in the night."
translation.ko: 다른 팀의 등반가 하나가 어젯밤 내려오질 않았대요

translation.en: "He's still up there."
There was a helicopter that was flying in to see where he was.
This is a really morbid thing to say.
We were hoping that he had passed in the night.
translation.ko: 우린 그 사람이 지난밤에 죽었길 바랐어요

translation.en: To consider that he had survived that long at that altitude,
and without oxygen was a pretty horrific thought.
translation.ko: 그렇게 오랜 시간 살아남는 건 너무 끔찍하니까요

translation.en: He waved as we went by.
I just started to cry.
[Nims] I thought, you know, "What if that was me?"
He was just gonna die in hope.
So we made the decision that we had to help.
Who's gonna be on the rescue team?
Me, Mingma, Gesman and Geljen.
translation.ko: 저와 밍마, 게스만 그리고 겔젠이 가기로 했죠

translation.en: [pilot] It's almost on the margins of the helicopter's limit.
translation.ko: 조난 지점은 헬리콥터의 비행 고도 한계 근처예요

translation.en: [Mingma in Nepali] I've been a mountaineer for 10 years.
translation.ko: "밍마 데이비드 셰르파" 저는 경력 10년 차의 산악인이에요

translation.en: I've been involved in more than 100 rescues.
[Geljen] We were tired and didn't have much energy.
translation.ko: 우린 지쳤고 기력도 없었어요 "겔젠 셰르파 프로젝트 파서블 팀"

translation.en: I was scared about how the helicopter
would drop us from above. I was very nervous.
translation.ko: 내려 줄 거라는 생각에 긴장이 됐어요

translation.en: [Don in English] Bravery doesn't even remotely describe what those guys had to do to go back up.
translation.ko: 산을 다시 올라간 이들의 행동은 용기라는 말로는 부족해요

translation.en: You finally summit one of the most dangerous mountains in the world,
translation.ko: 세상에서 가장 위험한 산을 간신히 올랐는데

translation.en: and now you gotta go back up there?
It is a roll of the dice.
[Nims, muffled] Hello!
Your friends are here, okay?
You go home now.
Don't worry. Oxygen, oxygen, we'll give oxygen.
[in Nepali] Quick, quick!
[in English] Every second means a life to him.
We knew that the helicopter couldn't come at night.
So, we had to get him down to Camp 4 as fast as possible.
translation.ko: 그러니 그를 캠프 4로 최대한 빨리 데리고 가야 했죠

translation.en: You're very strong!
We go home, okay?
[in Nepali] Gesman, make a pillow for him.
translation.ko: 게스만, 이 사람에게 베개 좀 만들어 줘

translation.en: [in English] That night we just had to slap ourself to keep us awake,
translation.ko: 그날 밤은 자지 않으려고 뺨을 때려 가며 지새웠죠

translation.en: and we just took him down to Camp 3 at 6:00 a.m.
Only five minutes before the helicopter came.
translation.ko: 도착한 지 5분도 안 돼서 헬리콥터가 왔죠

translation.en: [Don] I immediately went over and I put my hand on his neck.
translation.ko: 곧장 가서 그 사람 목에 손을 대 봤어요

translation.en: He was alive and breathing, but barely.
translation.ko: 살아는 있었지만 겨우 숨만 쉬는 상태였죠

translation.en: [Nims] We had to get him to the hospital as soon as possible.
[Don] Those guys were really, really risking their lives.
translation.ko: 그들은 정말 위험한 일에 목숨을 걸었어요

translation.en: That is a testament to the character that they have.
This is the house that I grew up as a kid.
-[in Nepali] Hello. Are you well? -Yes, we are.
[Nims in English] The security is very tight here.
Mum used to lock this, you know,
so there were no nights out and stuff. You know?
translation.ko: 우리가 밤에 몰래 나가 놀지 못하도록요

translation.en: Hello, hello! Mummy?
I was born in a poor family.
My mum and dad gave everything for us.
Hello, Mum. Thank you. Thank you.
My mum wasn't a soft mum. She was tough for a reason.
translation.ko: 어머니는 엄한 분이셨어요 그럴 만한 이유가 있었죠

translation.en: I was always getting into trouble.
There wasn't a single day where I wasn't beaten by the teacher.
translation.ko: 선생님에게 맞지 않은 날이 하루도 없었어요

translation.en: [laughing] Because I was a naughty boy.
[Kamal] Because he had three older brothers, he was very competitive.
translation.ko: 형이 셋이나 있어서 님스는 경쟁심이 심했어요

translation.en: He was a fighter.
If there is any challenge, he wanted to face, and then he wanted to win.
translation.ko: 뭐든 도전할 일이 있으면 맞서서 이기려고 했어요

translation.en: [Nims] Four years ago, my dad had a heart attack
which made him half-paralyzed.
He had been a Gurkha.
[narrator] Considered one of the toughest fighting men in the world,
Gurkha regiments have fought valiantly in the British army for many years.
translation.ko: 구르카 군대는 여러 해 동안 영국군에서 용감히 싸웠죠

translation.en: [Nims] In Nepal, you had limited opportunities.
Being a Gurkha meant you could travel the world.
translation.ko: 구르카 군인이 되면 세계를 여행할 수 있죠

translation.en: The Gurkhas are steeped in history,
translation.ko: 구르카 군대는 아주 유서 깊은 집단이에요

translation.en: and they're unique soldiers.
The amount of effort that individuals
put into getting into the selection process is huge.
[man] Go!
[military colleague] So they've always had that additional layer of pride.
[Nims] In early life, I always used to compete against other people.
translation.ko: 어린 시절 저는 언제나 남들과 경쟁했어요

translation.en: I never knew how to back off.
[Nims] When I joined the Gurkhas, the biggest thing I learned
translation.ko: "구르카 훈련 캠프 2004년" 구르카 군에 입대하고 제가 배운 중요한 사실은

translation.en: was I have to compete against myself.
To be better than who I was yesterday.
My mum is in really ill health.
She has to go to hospital twice a week.
Me being the youngest son,
I have always been Mum's boy.
[Nims] I need her support
because this is the biggest challenge I have ever taken.
[Mum in Nepali] There is no one more special than you in this world, son.
translation.ko: 세상에 너만큼 특별한 사람은 없단다, 아들아

translation.en: Bless you.
[Kamal] Nirmal was telling us,
"I want to climb to show Mum what your son can do because of you."
translation.ko: '어머니를 위해 산을 오른단 걸 보여드릴 거야'

translation.en: [Nims] What did I get from my mum?
A lot, man. Yeah. A lot of things.
Coming from Nepal, I knew that I had the best team in the world.
translation.ko: 우리 팀이 세계 최고란 걸 저도 네팔 출신이라서 잘 알죠

translation.en: I made sure they were paid more money
than they would get from a Western expedition.
Climbing eight-thousanders is also a chance
for them to build their careers.
[in Nepali] Nepali mountaineers have a long history of mountaineering,
translation.ko: "밍마 데이비드의 목소리" 네팔 등반가들의 등반 역사는 아주 길어요

translation.en: but when it comes to taking the lead on the international platform,
we haven't been able to reach that level.
There is a big difference between climbing
for a foreign mountaineer and a Nepali one.
translation.ko: 네팔 산악인을 위한 등반은 전혀 달라요

translation.en: We are immensely proud that our leader is Nepali.
[Nims in English] We started making good progress,
but in the distance, I could see a huge cloud cover coming towards us.
translation.ko: 저 멀리서 커다란 구름이 우리 쪽으로 오는 게 보였죠

translation.en: We were carrying a really heavy pack.
We had to take our tent, oxygen tanks, the rope, everything.
translation.ko: 텐트, 산소 탱크, 로프 등 온갖 걸 다 짊어지고 있었죠

translation.en: You got to question yourself. Are you doing the right thing?
[in Nepali] At that stage, we were climbing despite the fear.
translation.ko: "락파의 목소리" 그 시점에서 우리는 두려움과 싸우며 산을 올랐어요

translation.en: One wrong move and we were gone. It was that kind of a situation.
translation.ko: 한 번이라도 실수하면 죽을 수도 있는 상황이었죠

translation.en: [Nims in English] I said to them, "Guys, this is my idea."
"If you feel like it's stupid and if you feel like you're gonna die,
you don't have to come with me."
But they kept going.
We left for the summit push at 9:00 p.m.
Hoping that we would summit the next morning.
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침에 정상에 닿길 바라면서요

translation.en: We summitted around 6:00 p.m. the next day.
It took 21 hours.
One of the hardest things I have ever done.
translation.ko: "0개월 19일 다울라기리 정상" 해본 중 가장 힘든 일이었어요

translation.en: Oh, man. Pure by force today.
If the team were not equally good, no summit.
translation.ko: 팀이 뛰어나지 않았다면 정상에 못 갔을 거예요

translation.en: Very tired today.
-Yeah, summit day! -[Geljen] Yup.
He doesn't drink normally. So thanks, man.
translation.ko: 원래는 술 안 마시는 친구예요, 고마워

translation.en: -What a day! -[Geljen] What a day, yeah.
[Nims] After serving six years with the Gurkhas,
I decided to apply for the UK Special Forces.
[Suchi] That was the first time I saw him working towards his goal.
translation.ko: 그가 목표를 향해 노력하는 모습을 그때 처음으로 봤어요

translation.en: And how crazy he is.
He used to wake up 2:00 or 3:00 in the morning,
run for 20 kilometers,
carrying 75 pounds on his back.
Work all day, and then he would be off to the gym.
He wouldn't be back until 11:00.
That's how it was for six months.
[Nims] I became the first Gurkha in history
to be selected for the Special Boat Service.
translation.ko: 영국 해군 특전대에 뽑힌 구르카 군인이 됐어요

translation.en: Being in the Special Forces representing Nepal, wow!
Come on.
I learned quickly, whatever the situation is,
translation.ko: 어떤 상황이든 통제력을 잃지 않아야 하는 걸

translation.en: you have to stay in control.
I'm going to have to cut away.
The whole experience gave me confidence to take on massive challenges.
translation.ko: 이 경험으로 큰일에 도전할 자신감이 생겼어요

translation.en: But in 2011…
I was in a gun battle.
I was on a rooftop, providing fire support.
translation.ko: 저는 옥상에서 지원 사격을 하고 있었죠

translation.en: All of a sudden…
I'm falling through the air.
I hit the ground.
I thought I had been shot in the face.
It was a sniper aiming for my neck.
translation.ko: 저격수가 제 목을 겨누고 총을 쐈던 거죠

translation.en: But luckily, the bullet hit the extender of my weapon.
translation.ko: 하지만 운 좋게도 총알은 제 총의 개머리판에 맞았어요

translation.en: And the gun saved my life.
A couple of centimeters either way,
that's the difference between life and death.
[Suchi] My friends ask, "How do you do all of this?"
translation.ko: 제 친구들은 묻곤 해요 '이런 삶을 어떻게 견뎌?'

translation.en: My answer is always, "If I am constantly worrying about him,
translation.ko: 전 늘 이렇게 대답해요 '계속 그이를 걱정하기만 해서는'

translation.en: then it's not going to do any good to me."
I would break down.
You have to be strong.
I've never wanted to deviate him from his dream or his goals.
translation.ko: 그이가 꿈이나 목표를 포기하길 바란 적은 절대 없어요

translation.en: He knew what he wanted to do in life.
translation.ko: 자신의 삶에서 뭘 하고 싶은지 잘 아니까요

translation.en: People today, if you ask them, "Why you go to the high peaks?"
translation.ko: 사람들에게 높은 산을 왜 오르냐고 물으면

translation.en: They say, "Because it's fun." I don't believe them. It's not fun.
translation.ko: 재밌어서 오른다고 해요 안 믿어요, 그럴 리가요

translation.en: It's a place where you have to learn to cope with pain because it's painful.
translation.ko: 산은 고통을 견디는 법을 배워야 하는 곳이에요

translation.en: [Nims] Eight o'clock in the morning, we reach base camp.
Helicopter fly to Kathmandu yesterday. Party. No sleep.
translation.ko: 어제 카트만두로 날아갔고 파티하느라 잠도 못 잤죠

translation.en: -Project Possible. -Project Possible, brother.
[Nims] After we summitted Dhaulagiri, we had been partying in Kathmandu.
translation.ko: 우리는 다울라기리를 등정한 뒤 카트만두에서 파티를 열었어요

translation.en: I was struggling a bit, and I was hungover.
Most people climb this mountain in stages.
translation.ko: 대부분의 사람은 단계를 나눠 이 산을 올라요

translation.en: They go to Camp 1. They'll sleep over there.
Camp 2, sleep over there.
Camp 3, Camp 4, and then to the summit.
Because of the weather window, we had to climb in one day.
translation.ko: 날씨가 허락을 안 해서 하루 만에 올라야 했어요

translation.en: [Chin] For Nims to climb Kanchenjunga
in a single push from base camp to the summit
while hungover is, uh… [laughing] I mean…
I don't know what to think of that.
It's completely absurd.
[Nims] Now, we are here at Camp 2.
The plan is to go and hit the summit directly.
translation.ko: 우리 계획은 정상까지 바로 올라가는 거예요

translation.en: So we won't be sleeping.
[Chin] Expeditions to 8,000-meter peaks take a huge toll on your body.
translation.ko: 8,000m 봉우리를 오르는 건 몸에 엄청난 부담을 줘요

translation.en: Once you get above 8,000 meters,
you're in what is called the death zone.
You're breathing about a third of the amount of oxygen
you're normally breathing at sea level.
The biggest danger of climbing with oxygen is,
translation.ko: 산소를 가지고 등반할 때의 가장 큰 위험은

translation.en: you become dependent on it.
If you run out,
your body is in an environment that it's not adapted to.
translation.ko: 몸이 적응하지 못한 환경에 내던져지는 거예요

translation.en: Imagine not being able to breathe.
Bloody hell.
Yeah, we summitted one of the best mountain in the world.
I'm doing some crazy stuff.
translation.ko: 전 정신 나간 일을 벌이고 있죠

translation.en: Look… [exhales] I got nothing more to give.
Bye-bye, Kanchenjunga.
One hundred meters below the summit,
we found another climber completely messed up.
He had run out of oxygen.
[Nims] Be strong. We'll go home.
translation.ko: 힘을 내요, 우린 집에 갈 거예요

translation.en: [Mingma in Nepali] We need to get to Camp 4 now.
[Nims in English] Go, go. Go.
When you come off the oxygen at that altitude,
it is extremely dangerous.
But without oxygen, you'll never be able to survive this.
translation.ko: 산소가 없이는 절대 살아남을 수 없어요

translation.en: In the military, I have never left anyone behind.
translation.ko: 군대에 있을 때 전우를 버린 적이 한 번도 없어요

translation.en: I wasn't gonna do that on the mountains.
So we gave the climber our oxygen.
translation.ko: 그래서 그에게 우리 산소를 나눠 줬어요

translation.en: And we made the radio contact on all the camps saying,
"Hey, guys, we need help."
There were a lot of climbers at Camp 4,
and I said, "Look, just bring the oxygen."
[base camp in Nepali] I'm trying to contact them, but no one is picking up the radio.
translation.ko: 연락하려고 하는데 아무도 무전을 받지 않아

translation.en: [Mingma] The wind is getting stronger and his oxygen is almost finished.
translation.ko: 바람이 점점 심해져 산소도 거의 다 떨어졌고

translation.en: [base camp on radio] Don't risk your life. Come down now.
[Nims] It's not in my blood to leave a person behind.
translation.ko: 난 절대로 사람을 버리고 가지 않아

translation.en: [Nims in English] The climber was massively struggling,
but I can't see any head torches coming towards us for help.
translation.ko: 우리를 도우러 오는 횃불은 하나도 보이지 않았어요

translation.en: -[Nims] Does anybody have oxygen? -[Mingma] There's no more oxygen.
translation.ko: - 산소 있는 사람 없어? - 산소 다 떨어졌어

translation.en: [Nims] There's no oxygen left.
[Mingma] Nims, brother…
If we stay any longer, we'll die as well.
[Nims] What can I do, brother? No one has come to help.
translation.ko: 그럼 어떡해? 아무도 도우러 안 오잖아

translation.en: [in English] Brother…
I was told people were coming.
Brother…
I was told so many times.
Oh my God. No one is coming.
[Suchi] I was at home and my phone rings.
I could hear Nims' voice.
And my heart sank.
He said, "He died in my arms."
"Nobody came to help us."
It was really scary.
He's got such a big project.
But he will always be the first person to offer help to anyone.
translation.ko: 사람을 돕는 데 언제나 앞장서곤 했어요

translation.en: [Nims] I was making my way down.
Mingma and Gesman were far ahead of me.
translation.ko: 밍마와 게스만은 저보다 훨씬 앞서 있었죠

translation.en: I had been off oxygen for more than 11 hours.
I started developing HACE.
[narrator] Can mere man overcome the relentless forces of nature?
translation.ko: 무자비한 자연의 힘을 한낱 인간이 이길 수 있을까요?

translation.en: [Nims] HACE is high-altitude cerebral edema.
You can't control your movements.
[narrator] Can they contend with altitude that robs a man of energy and will power,
translation.ko: 인간의 힘과 의지를 앗아 가고 느릿한 꿈속에 가둬 두는

translation.en: and makes him move in a slow-motion dream?
translation.ko: 이 높은 고도에 맞서 싸울 수 있을까요?

translation.en: [Nims] I don't have enough power. I don't have enough strength.
I just felt helpless.
I was scared, to be honest.
I needed to get down the mountain quickly.
It's a matter of life and death.
Suddenly, I started to lose control.
I saw a huge figure standing tall.
A big monster with the hair of a Yeti.
If I don't do something, I'm going to be dead.
translation.ko: 뭐라도 하지 않으면 전 죽은 목숨이었어요

translation.en: I said, "Hey, can you hear me?"
He's like, "Help."
"Help."
He was a climber who was lost.
He had HACE as well.
I had to gather all my energy and resources to help him down to Camp 4.
translation.ko: 저는 남은 힘과 수단을 모두 써서 그를 캠프 4로 데려다줬어요

translation.en: I was mentally and physically drained.
For the first time, I started to question my plan.
I didn't set foot on the mountains until 2012.
That's when I realized
how strong a climber I was.
I just fell in love with the physical and mental challenge.
translation.ko: 신체적, 정신적 도전에 푹 빠져 버렸어요

translation.en: [Barber] We're here today, testing Nims' ability
translation.ko: "제임스 바버 고도 훈련가" 오늘은 님스가 고도 6,000m에서 3분 동안

translation.en: to get through three minutes at 6,000 meters while cycling
translation.ko: 오늘은 님스가 고도 6,000m에서 3분 동안 자전거를 탈 수 있는지 시험할 겁니다

translation.en: to see how his body reacts to a lack of oxygen
translation.ko: 자전거를 탈 수 있는지 시험할 겁니다 산소 부족에 몸이 어떻게 반응하는지

translation.en: whilst also making decisions quickly and accurately.
translation.ko: 빠르고 정확한 판단이 가능한지 볼 겁니다

translation.en: For context, we've had world-record, ultra-endurance cyclists
translation.ko: 참고로 세계 기록을 가진 인내심 강한 자전거 선수들도

translation.en: who've only been able to manage about 90 seconds
before we've had to cancel the test.
Keep going, Nims. One… One more minute to go.
[Nims] Physically, I believe I have a natural gift.
I can climb with no sleep or rest at all.
translation.ko: 자거나 쉬지 않고도 산을 오를 수 있죠

translation.en: It doesn't matter how extreme the challenge is.
I'm not going to give up.
[Barber] Last ten seconds. Try and get through this one.
Last ten seconds.
Five, three, two, one. And stop there. Relax there, relax there. Stop there.
[Barber] We can't underestimate how strong it is
that he was able to get through the three minutes.
His physiology means he's got more oxygen available to him
for physical work by the muscles,
and also for decision-making to use his brain.
translation.ko: 쓸 수 있는 산소량이 더 많아요

translation.en: Which means he's able to operate at a far higher level.
translation.ko: 훨씬 더 높은 고도에서도 활동할 수 있다는 거죠

translation.en: This is your blood-oxygen saturation here.
-[Nims] Yeah. -In the blue. What's interesting…
I've not seen better results than Nims'.
translation.ko: 님스보다 나은 결과는 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: [Nims] Have you done yours?
-Have I done mine? -[Nims] Yeah.
Yes. [laughing]
-[Nims] How is it? -[laughing]
-Not like that. [laughs] -Not like that? Good then, awesome.
[Kamal] He came to my house.
He said he wanted to leave the Army.
I said, "Nirmal, no. You cannot do this."
Mum was very seriously ill,
and Nirmal is the biggest financial asset for the family.
translation.ko: 니르말은 가족의 가장 큰 경제적 버팀목이었어요

translation.en: He had just six years left in the Army.
I said to him, "Make sure you get the pension,
translation.ko: 저는 그랬어요 '꼭 복무를 끝내서 연금을 받으렴'

translation.en: then afterwards, whatever you want to do, we do not stop you."
But he doesn't listen to me.
And he quit the Army.
We had a bitter row.
I didn't talk to him for three months.
translation.ko: 그 애와 석 달간 말도 안 했죠

translation.en: [Nims] For my family, it was very uncertain.
Normally, the youngest son look after their parents in Nepal.
But climbing eight-thousanders had become my passion.
translation.ko: 하지만 8,000m 봉우리 등반은 제 열정적인 꿈이 됐어요

translation.en: I wanted to show the world what a human can do.
translation.ko: 한 인간의 능력을 온 세상에 보여주고 싶었죠

translation.en: [Kamal] I said, "Waste of time."
"Waste of money."
I said to him, "You're only thinking of yourself."
"You don't think about your family, how we feel."
I love my brother so very much.
I don't want my brother to die.
[Suchi] There was no funding.
And we only had a few months to raise the money.
translation.ko: 돈을 모을 시간은 고작 몇 달 뿐이었고요

translation.en: In the Nepalese culture, you give.
So asking for money was one of the toughest things he's done.
translation.ko: 그러니 돈을 부탁하는 건 "프로젝트 파서블" 그가 해 본 중 가장 어려운 일이었어요

translation.en: When he was approaching potential sponsors,
he basically sounded like a lunatic.
The project will prove the power of possible.
translation.ko: 가능성의 힘을 증명할 프로젝트가 될 것입니다

translation.en: The amount he needed was huge.
But nobody believed he could do it.
translation.ko: 누구도 님스가 해낼 거라고 믿지 않았죠

translation.en: Thank you all for being here.
All he was getting was disappointment.
[man over phone] I'm in awe of your desire to want to do it,
but there hasn't been any money forthcoming.
It's not investable.
[Suchi] It was time to make a decision how we're going to do this.
Nims gets this idea.
The idea was to remortgage the house.
Everything was on the line.
But I believed in him.
[Nims] I'd only summited three mountains.
My next target,
the highest mountain in the world.
[Nims] On Everest, the mountain is run by the Sherpas.
They work so hard to support the Westerners.
They take a massive risk.
Without their support, there wouldn't be a climbing season.
translation.ko: 그들 없이는 등반 시즌도 없을 거예요

translation.en: [Chin] The guided route on Mount Everest in the spring
translation.ko: 인솔자가 이끄는 봄철 에베레스트산을 오르는 일은

translation.en: is pretty far removed from anything else in mountaineering.
translation.ko: 다른 곳의 산악 등반과는 전혀 달라요

translation.en: There are literally hundreds of climbers trying to get to the top.
translation.ko: 수백 명의 등반가가 정상에 가려고 몰려들죠

translation.en: You clip into a fixed line that has been set by Sherpas.
translation.ko: 셰르파들이 설치해 놓은 고정 로프를 타고 올라가요

translation.en: And it's a highway up to the summit.
[Nims] I knew that there were loads of people on the mountain,
translation.ko: 산에 사람들이 엄청나게 몰려 있다는 건 알았어요

translation.en: I was wary of that. But I also knew that I had the speed.
translation.ko: 그래서 걱정이 됐죠 하지만 제 강점은 속도예요

translation.en: [climber] Here's to the mission, Everest, and Lhotse, and Makalu.
translation.ko: 이게 이번 여정이에요 에베레스트, 로체, 마칼루

translation.en: -[Nims] Thank you, brother. -Cheers.
-Oh my God! -Oh my!
For you! Only for you!
translation.ko: 널 위해서야! 오직 널 위한 거!

translation.en: [Nims] I wasn't planning on just climbing Everest.
translation.ko: 에베레스트만 오르는 게 제 계획은 아니었어요

translation.en: I wanted to climb Everest, Lhotse, and Makalu,
translation.ko: 세계에서 첫 번째 네 번째, 다섯 번째로 높은

translation.en: the world's first, fourth,
and fifth highest mountains within 48 hours.
No one has ever done that before.
We overtook 95% of the people on the way up.
translation.ko: 올라오는 길에 만난 사람들 95%를 앞질러 왔어요

translation.en: We summited quite early in the morning around 5:30.
On the summit…
your soul becomes part of the mountain.
It makes you feel alive.
[Madison] Spring 2019 Everest was a perfect storm.
translation.ko: 2019년 봄의 에베레스트는 최악의 상황이었어요 "개릿 매디슨의 목소리 친구 & 고산 등반가"

translation.en: There was a weather window, but only for May 22nd and May 23rd.
So you've got 400 climbers, plus another 400 Sherpas,
all planning their summit attempts, in this two-day weather window.
translation.ko: 그 이틀 동안 등정하려고 전부 벼르고 있었어요

translation.en: [Nims in Nepali] No one is moving at all.
Hey, boys, what are you trying to do?
[in English] The queue was so intense.
People were fighting who needs to have the priority over going up or going down.
translation.ko: 누가 먼저 오르고 내려가나 다투고 있었죠

translation.en: [in Nepali] These guys, man.
[in English] We started to descend down.
I look back
and took a picture.
I posted the photo online.
It went viral around the world.
translation.ko: 사진은 전 세계에서 엄청난 반향을 불러일으켰죠

translation.en: [reporter 1] On the way to the top of the world…
[in German] Traffic jam on Mount Everest.
Look at this, 300 climbers queuing to make the summit.
translation.ko: 이걸 보세요, 등반가 300명이 정상에 가려고 줄을 섰어요

translation.en: [reporter 2 in French] A single file on the roof of the world.
[reporter 1] The astonishing photo was taken by Nims Purja.
translation.ko: 이 놀라운 사진을 찍은 사람은 님스 푸르자입니다

translation.en: Hundreds of climbers…
[Nims] Things just went absolutely crazy.
But I was so focused. Bring it on.
translation.ko: 하지만 전 등정 생각뿐이었어요 덤벼 보시지

translation.en: In the death zone, I come alive.
translation.ko: 죽음의 지대는 제게 생명을 불어넣어 줘요

translation.en: Yeah, brother. No messing around!
translation.ko: 그래, 친구, 방심하면 안 돼! "프로젝트 파서블: 0개월 29일 로체 정상, 5월 22일"

translation.en: Everest, Lhotse, and Makalu in 48 hours.
The new world record.
It's been epic.
I know many people didn't believe me when I started,
translation.ko: 제가 처음 시작했을 때 사람들은 절 안 믿었지만

translation.en: but I'm here right on top of Makalu,
translation.ko: 지금 전 여기 마칼루 정상에 서 있어요

translation.en: and it ends the first phase of Project Possible.
Hello, Mummy.
[Mum in Nepali] How many mountains have you climbed?
Six.
I've climbed Annapurna, Dhaulagiri, Kanchenjunga,
Mount Everest, Lhotse, and Makalu.
How many left to climb?
Still eight mountains to go.
[in English] When it comes to Mother, she's our heart.

The Chinese government were saying the mountain is closed for this year.
translation.ko: 중국 정부가 올해는 산을 개방하지 않을 거라더군요

translation.en: Problem two, I was in the base camp of Manaslu,
translation.ko: 두 번째 문제는 마나슬루 베이스캠프에 왔는데

translation.en: but Cho Oyu will be closed next week.
I had to move fast.
There's no time for stopping, brother.
We're heading back to catch our flight,
so that we can enter Tibet by tomorrow evening.
translation.ko: 내일 저녁에는 티베트에 들어갈 수 있게요

translation.en: [Suchi] Most people normally plan for one expedition,
translation.ko: 대부분의 사람은 한 번의 등정만 계획하지만

translation.en: but here we're planning for 14.
The logistics were very stressful.
[Nims] The vehicle can't go any further than this.
The deadline is running out of our hands,
and I could see how much pressure he's going through.
So, we are at the Cho Oyu base camp. [exhales]
[Suchi] We were all worried about him.
Yeah, it's an absolute pleasure to be here on the summit of Cho Oyu.
And, uh, in few days' time, I'll give you the summit of Manaslu.
translation.ko: 그리고 며칠 내로 마나슬루산 정상에도 오를 겁니다

translation.en: [Suchi] For Nims as well, behind the scenes,
his mum was on his mind.
It was a constant worry for him.
[Nims] Standing on top of Manaslu, I was obviously happy.
But inside my chest…
I was feeling that it could be my last mountain.
[Chin] The one thing at this point that could stop Nims from finishing…
was access to the final mountain, Shishapangma.
To any normal person,
the Chinese government giving you a hard no
would be a moment to, you know, walk away.
[in Nepali] They have said no climbers are allowed on Shishapangma.
But if it goes through a Nepali government official,
they may allow it.
[Suchi] Nims was non-stop meeting politicians.
What can we do for humanity? To prove that power of possibility.
translation.ko: 인류를 위해 뭘 할 수 있을까요? 가능성의 힘을 증명하는 거죠

translation.en: The former prime minister.
Sir, as a Nepali, I thought of this project as this country's project.
translation.ko: 네팔인으로서 이 프로젝트는 네팔의 과제라고도 생각합니다

translation.en: But this could take four, five, six months.
translation.ko: 하지만 몇 달이 걸릴지 알 수 없었죠

translation.en: [Nims in English] This is for everyone here in this room.
Everyone who is in Nepal.
I'm no one compared to the power of China.
translation.ko: 중국의 힘에 비교하면 저는 아무것도 아니죠

translation.en: But I was never gonna get fazed by that.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 사실에도 전 절대 흔들리지 않았어요

translation.en: I took two routes.
One, the political process.
The second was…
I asked my followers for help.
[Suchi] Many wrote to the Chinese government.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 중국 정부에 편지를 보냈어요 "꼭 보낼게요, 님스"

translation.en: From all over the world.
[Nims] I also started to get support from the mountaineering community.
translation.ko: "당신은 사자의 심장을 가진 전사예요" 산악인 공동체도 저를 지지해 주기 시작했죠

translation.en: -Yeah! Hey, Nims. Conrad. -Jimmy. [laughs]
translation.ko: "콘래드_앵커 님스다이와 팀에 좋은 기운을!" - 안녕, 님스, 콘래드예요 - 난 지미예요 "콘래드 앵커 산악인"

translation.en: Shout-out to you, man. You've got Shishapangma.
You're the man. Crush it.
It is a project not only for himself,
but for Nepal, for the Sherpas, for mountaineering.
translation.ko: 네팔, 셰르파, 등반계를 위한 프로젝트예요 "진짜 터미네이터"

translation.en: [Suchi] The Chinese government saw the whole world is supporting him.
translation.ko: 중국 정부는 전 세계가 님스를 지지하는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: [Nims] Finally, the news came through that
the Chinese were opening the mountain for me and my team.
One mountain to go.
Let's do this.
This is my last mountain.
Let's take it slow.
Let's make it really easy.
That was the plan. [chuckles]
[in Nepali] What's up with this weather?
Gesman. Gesman, brother.
We need to tie the ropes.
[in English] It was horrendous.
[in Nepali] We were really worried.
No one had climbed Shishapangma since 2014.
translation.ko: 2014년 이래 누구도 시샤팡마를 등반한 적이 없었어요

translation.en: [Nims in English] It's an avalanche.
[in Nepali] Who is my team? Can we do this?
translation.ko: "밍마 데이비드의 목소리" 내 팀은 누구인가? 우린 할 수 있을까?

translation.en: These are the questions you ask yourself in this kind of situation.
But the project had become our dream,
translation.ko: 하지만 이 프로젝트는 우리의 꿈이 되었고

translation.en: and we were focused on making it come true.
[Nims in English] In life, you have to keep doing what you believe.
translation.ko: 우리는 살면서 자신이 믿는 바를 계속 추구해야 해요

translation.en: You have to ask yourself, do you really want this from your heart?
translation.ko: 진심으로 원해서 하는 일인지 자신에게 물어야 하죠

translation.en: Is it for the self-glory?
Or is it for something bigger?
Sometimes, the idea that you come up with
may seem impossible to the rest of the world,
but that doesn't mean it's impossible to you.
And if you can inspire one or two people in a good way,
translation.ko: 한두 사람의 마음을 움직일 수만 있다면

translation.en: then you can inspire the world.
Yes! Shishapangma! Yeah!
When I was on the summit, I got on the radio.
[in Nepali] Mum…
[in English] I said, "Mum, you know that project I was talking about?"
"That is over."
We did it.
[Kamal] Mum obviously was very ill.
But she's a very stubborn lady.
She hang on, she fight, she fight, she fight until her youngest son succeeds.
translation.ko: 막내아들이 성공할 때까지 싸우고, 또 싸우며 버티셨어요

translation.en: [Nims] For her to be part of that moment of success
and to be able to celebrate that together,
nothing can beat that, bro.
[Kamal] My mum said, "Kamal, he has got godly spirit."
translation.ko: 어머니가 그러셨죠 '그 애는 신성한 영혼을 가졌어'

translation.en: She was… [sighs]
[Nims] Hi, Mingma.
-[man] Congratulations. -Thank you. Thank you.
-Congratulations. -Thank you.
[Suchi] I always knew he doesn't give up.
I had so many gray hairs because of the stress that I was going through.
translation.ko: 스트레스를 받아서 제 머리가 다 셀 지경이었죠

translation.en: It was a roller coaster.
[in Nepali] We made the impossible possible by our teamwork.
translation.ko: "밍마 데이비드의 목소리" 우리는 협동심으로 불가능을 가능으로 만들었죠

translation.en: Good leadership is also required to achieve success,
and Nims demonstrated that very well.
translation.ko: 님스는 그 리더십을 아주 잘 발휘했고요

translation.en: [Mingma in Nepali] Reaching that international level
is a big help for Nepali climbers in the future.
translation.ko: 네팔 등반가들에게 장차 큰 도움을 줄 거예요

translation.en: Hey, guys. Now we have climbed 14 highest mountains in the world. Right?
translation.ko: 조심하세요! 우리는 세계에서 가장 높은 14개의 산을 등정했죠

translation.en: Let's be brutally honest,
if this was done by some European or Western climber,
the news would have been ten times bigger than this.
translation.ko: 취재진이 열 배는 더 많았을 겁니다

translation.en: Let's give the justice to the people who really deserve the justice.
translation.ko: 진정 인정받아야 할 이들에게 공로를 돌립시다

translation.en: And you guys have the power.
Let's unite, let's make a difference.
[in Nepali] Thank you.
[Nims in English] Project Possible team!
He has all my respect.
He did this with his strategy.
[Messner] And he did it first.
This was a unique statement in the history of mountaineering.
Thank you.
What's next, mate?
Well, I haven't even started it.
translation.ko: 글쎄요, 아직 생각도 안 해 봤어요

translation.en: And you know what? Next, we go even bigger.
Yeah.
Go.
See you soon, okay?
Just wait and see.
And I mean it.
See us again.
